channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge dog fouling up side of building wall, 14th October
item.description:
This has been there for ages. Hazardous and on a route that children take to the playground.

item.category: Dead animal in the carriageway or footway

item.title: Enormous amount of rubbish in front garden / footpath, 14th October
item.description:
Large amount of rubbish has been left in view on Glasbrook Road for a considerable time now. I see this regularly when walking past. Looks like family just need some help clearing things out. Very depressing to see this in the neighbourhood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glasbrook Road, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 14th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Crescent, Longlands, London

item.title: Van abandoned by person who moved 2 years ago, 14th October
item.description:
Van left behind, weeds growing around it, children may play near. Rubbish left with it please prosecute owner as he abandoned it basically now fly tipping 5 years ago. He moved to Sidcup, his name is Brian he used to live at 880 Sidcup road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 878, Sidcup Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Street light not working opposite 15a, 14th October
item.description:

item.title: Dead fox in garden, 14th October
item.description:
A fox has died in the garden. Per the Bromley website, it has been placed in two sealed bags at the edge of the property to be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greencourt Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant overflowing public bin, 14th October
item.description:
Every week local people decide to dump their domestic waste and dog bags outside the primary school. This has been going on for years. The only solution is to remove this bin - it’s a public health hazard - particularly for the kids on their way to school

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge, mattress, bed base dumped under the railway bridge on Urlwin Street., 14th October
item.description:
I posted (Sat 11th Oct 2025) that two large fridges had been dumped under the railway bridge on Urlwin Street. Your update states that that the “case has been fixed and is closed.” However, one has gone but the other FRIDGE is still there (see photo). A MATTRESS and BED BASE and DUVET have now joined the remaining fridge. Please could they all be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Urlwin Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again not collected fully, 14th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Trinity Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Chipboard coverings, 14th October
item.description:
I’m not sure if the chipboard is covering an electrical outlet next to the Let’s Tan shop in Pickford lane. It doesn’t look secure surely if this hiding an electrical outlet it should be fixed properly! Looks poorly prompt up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped fridge and other household items, 14th October
item.description:
Dumped fridge,door and other household items.Every week people are dumping their rubbish in this area.It is happening so often now that I make complains every week.We have had enough,please take action against flytipping in this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clevedon Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
